checkLoseForMove(Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Token) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
This method is called when I check the valid moves of a player If the return of that method is null I check if that player has lost the game or if he can move the other token If he lost it checks how many player there are If 2 the other one wins the game, if 3 this player is removed from the game

COLUMNS - it.polimi.ingsw.gui.Pics
 
computeGodChoices(PlayerAction) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
It parse the player action to get the chosen God, then that God is set to that player and removed from the allGodCards list After this if the list is empty it is started the routine for let players place their tokens and the allGodCards list is re-created If not then it is asked to the next player what God he wants
computeOpponentPlayers(ServerResponse) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.gui.SwingView
When needed, it returns the opponent players(1 or 2) of the player associated to this view.
computeTokens(int, int) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.gui.SwingView
When needed, it returns the token that has just been selected from the user, and even the not selected one (it can be useful).

computeValidMoves(Token, Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Battlefield) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
Here there is the ad-hoc call for the computeValidMoves method It is based on the player-in-turn God card If that God card does not modify the move than it calls the default move More JavaDOC inside the ad-hoc method
computeValidMoves(Token, Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Battlefield, List<Cell>) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameAction.move.ApolloMoves

computeValidMoves(Token, Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Battlefield, List<Cell>) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameAction.move.ArtemisMoves
It works as simple move, but for each cell of simple move it compute another simple move and add those cell to valid moves.

computeValidMoves(Token, Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Battlefield, List<Cell>) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameAction.move.MinotaurMoves
It considers even the cells in which there is on opponent token, but only in the case the cell behind him (in that direction) is unoccupied/not dome

computeValidMoves(Token, Token, List<Token>, GodCard, List<GodCard>, Battlefield, List<Cell>) - Method in class it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameAction.move.SimpleMoves
A token can move in all 8 Cells around himself with the following exceptions: he can not occupy a cell where is another token (regardless if it's his own or not); he can not move up on a height >1 of it's own; he can not move on a dome; he can not move out the battlefield.

Controller - Class in it.polimi.ingsw.controller
